io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.target

Interface ISyncTarget


  • public interface ISyncTarget
    Interface to implement for each synchronization target.

    This is the main interface to implement for each target to synchronize with. All other interfaces are provided by this library. So usually integrators do not need to implement other interfaces than this one.

    Transmit assets from Smint.io to any DAM (one-way)

    The purpose of instances of this interface is to store assets, bought on Smint.io to the target downstream Asset Management System (DAM). Smint.io is a purchase platform to easy acquiring of digital assets. These assets then can be stored with a local DAM. Instances implementing this interface support automatically storing of assets from Smint.io to a target DAM - in a one-way process, from Smint.io to DAM (Smint.io -->> DAM).

    Two-phased synchronization process

    At first, structured meta data is synchronized, containing all kinds of meta data types, asset types, licenses, etc. (see beforeGenericMetadataSync(), afterGenericMetadataSync()). Then binary assets are synchronized (see beforeAssetsSync(), afterAssetsSync()). This will ensure, all required meta data types and values are available on the target before the binaries are transmitted.

    Event driven notification for start and end of sync phases

    The synchronization process is driven outside of instances of this interface. However, these are notified of some events, eg: as soon as the overall sync process starts (see beforeSync()) or ends (see afterSync()). The same applies to each phase. At every start of a phase (see beforeGenericMetadataSync(), beforeAssetsSync()) instances may abort the synchronization process immediately. At the end of every phase (see afterGenericMetadataSync(), afterAssetsSync()) instances may perform some clean-up.

    At the moment, cleaning of the meta data cache is requested by calling clearGenericMetadataCaches(). This is executed at the end of the sync process. However, the meta data cache might be called at any time. The asset sync phase must not rely on an available and filled cache as a special sync task might be started on demand to synchronize assets only - without any meta data.

    Two kinds of events for initiating an synchronization process

    There are two kinds of events initiating a synchronization, as outlined in ISmintIoSynchronization. The scheduled synchronization will sync meta data, whereas the pushed kind of sync in case of a purchase will not.

    Parallel execution of imports

    When implementing a class, beware that all independent meta data may be imported in parallel by different threads. Please do not impose blocking of multiple threads to the implementing class. Instead support calling different imports by different threads at the same time and synchronize on the data level.
    eg: calling importBinaryTypes(ISmintIoMetadataElement[]) and importContentTypes(ISmintIoMetadataElement[]) could be parallelized as these handle distinct, independent content.

    Importing meta data information

    Meta data is imported in categories, whereas each category will receive a list of Smint.io values as instances of ISmintIoMetadataElement. The ISmintIoMetadataElement.getKey() of the list item will return the Smint.io API key for that item and the ISmintIoMetadataElement.getValues() will hold a list of localized names for that item. The localized name can be used with the UI. The list is not sorted in any way. See an example with JSON.

    For each Smint.io key (see ISmintIoMetadataElement.getKey()) a sync target ID must be created and a mapping must be maintained. The sync target ID will be used with assets to import or update. Its value will be retrieved for every Smint.io key! (eg: see getContentProviderKey(String)). In case the Smint.io key already exists, just update/overwrite the localized names retrieved by ISmintIoMetadataElement.getValues(). Implementing classes must not create new sync target ID. It would lead to big mess with the meta data, as the strictly 1:1 relation between these keys would be broken.

    Whenever meta data is synchronized, ALL data will be written to the sync target. There is no detection of already existing meta data on the sync target, as the metadata items are so limited in list size that additional checks would impose more performance penalty than any improvements. So, upon importing meta data, expect to some across already existing Smint.io key. This is perfectly natural and expected behavior. However, implementors must not delete keys on sync target that are not passed to the importing functions. These keys might still be used with assets. Deleting them without any checks would break their meta information.

    • Method Detail

      • getCapabilities

        ISyncTargetCapabilities getCapabilities()
        Provides information about features this sync target supports and thus is capable of.
        Returns:
        Must not return null but always a valid instance!

      • beforeSync

        boolean beforeSync()
        A hook to be called before any synchronization is started in this turn.

        This hook is called right before any synchronization takes place. If some preparations or are to be made in advance, a task must be returned. If synchronization does not need to be prepared or any status checked or altered, then simply return an empty task, doing nothing.

        Although this task is executed in an asynchronous way, synchronization is only started after this tasks ends successfully. In case the tasks aborts, crashes or ends unsuccessfully, synchronization is terminated immediately with proper logging. Such ending usually is indicated by throwing an exception.

        Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization. So make sure all exceptions to be ignored are caught within the task.

        Returns:
        A boolean value, indicating whether to continue synchronization or not. true means, synchronization will continue, whereas false aborts the sync task without further notice.

      • beforeGenericMetadataSync

        boolean beforeGenericMetadataSync()
        Is called right before the generic meta data is about to be synced but after beforeSync().

        This hook is only called in case the generic meta data is to be synchronized. Usually this is done on a regular and scheduled basis. Additionally to a re-scheduled background task for synchronization asset content is synced on demand - without any generic meta data.

        Although this task is executed in an asynchronous way, synchronization is only started after this tasks ends successfully. In case the tasks returns false synchronization of generic meta data is aborted immediately. In case the task crashes with an exception, overall synchronization is terminated without syncing any asset.

        Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization. So make sure all exceptions to be ignored are caught within the task.

        Returns:
        A boolean value, indicating whether to continue meta data synchronization or not. true means, synchronization will continue, whereas false aborts the sync task without further notice and without calling afterGenericMetadataSync().

      • importContentProviders

        void importContentProviders(ISmintIoMetadataElement[] contentProviders)
        Import the provided list of content providers.

        For general information about meta data import, see Import Meta Data Information in the heading section above. Example data for this meta data category is: 

         [
     {
         "getKey": "getty",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "Getty Images",
             "de": "Getty Images"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "istock",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "iStock",
             "de": "iStock"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "shutterstock",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "Shutterstock",
             "de": "Shutterstock"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "adobestock",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "Adobe Stock",
             "de": "Adobe Stock"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "panthermedia",
         "getValues()": {
             "en": "PantherMedia",
             "de": "PantherMedia"
         }
     }
 ]
        Parameters:
        contentProviders - the list of content providers used with Smint.io.

      • getContentProviderKey

        String getContentProviderKey(String smintIoProviderId)
        Maps the Smint.io ID of a Content Provider to a synchronization target ID/key.

        Each available content provider in the Smint.io platform needs a corresponding representation of the target side. This is necessary to track the origin of assets. Hence a one-to-one mapping is required. Therefore a direct translation of the IDs on both platforms (Smint.io + sync target) is necessary.

        Implementation of ISyncJob will make use of this target ID to provide prepared assets that can be easily compared to the data already available on the sync target.

        The Smin.io ID to map is retrieved from ISmintIoAsset.getContentProvider().

        Parameters:
        smintIoProviderId - the ID on the Smint.io platform.
        Returns:
        the key on the synchronization target, or null in case the item does not exist yet on the target or if parameter the is null.
        See Also:
        getContentProviderKey(String), ISmintIoAsset.getContentProvider()

      • importLicenseLanguages

        void importLicenseLanguages(ISmintIoMetadataElement[] licenseLanguages)
        Import the provided list of languages a license for an asset is restricted to.

        The usage of assets may be limited to certain languages or certain languages may be excluded. Smint.io keeps a list of all languages ever used within licensing on the platform as meta data. This list is provided here and linked to if such a restriction is applicable.

        For general information about meta data import, see Import Meta Data Information in the heading section above. Example data for this meta data category is: 

         [
     {
         "Key": "ara",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Arabisch",
             "en": "Arabic"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "rus",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Russisch",
             "en": "Russian"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "ben",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Bengali",
             "en": "Bengali"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "eng",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Englisch",
             "en": "English"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "spa",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Spanisch",
             "en": "Spanish"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "hns",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Hindi",
             "en": "Hindustani"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "fra",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Franzsisch",
             "en": "French"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "ger",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Deutsch",
             "en": "German"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "cmn",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Mandarin",
             "en": "Mandarin"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "any",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Alle",
             "en": "Any"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "por",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Portugiesisch",
             "en": "Portuguese"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "msa",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Malaysisch",
             "en": "Malay"
         }
     }
 ]

        Each ISmintIoMetadataElement.getKey() will return a valid ISO 639-3 code. Smint.io uses other codes internally with its RESTful API but these codes are translated to their ISO counterparts by this library.
        Although this library is delivering the same localized text as used with Smint.io web page, it would be better to use the name, available to your system - if there is some. So to get the proper localized name from "Mandarin" by using something like new Locale("cmn").getDisplayLanguage(). However there might not be translations for all languages available with your Java VM. So either use the values provided here, or use an external library for such cases.

        Parameters:
        licenseLanguages - the list of languages a license may restrict the usage of assets to.

      • getLicenseLanguageKey

        String getLicenseLanguageKey(String smintIoId)
        Maps the Smint.io ID of a License Language to a synchronization target ID/key.

        The Smin.io ID to map is retrieved from ISmintIoLicenseTerm.getAllowedLanguages().

        Beware that the value "any" is used in addition to the ISO 639-3 codes, in order to denote any language. There is not ISO code for that case.

        Parameters:
        smintIoId - the ID on the Smint.io platform.
        Returns:
        the key on the synchronization target, or null in case the item does not exist yet on the target or if parameter the is null.
        See Also:
        getContentProviderKey(String), ISmintIoLicenseTerm.getAllowedLanguages()

        See Also:
        getContentProviderKey(String), ISmintIoLicenseTerm.getUsageLimits()

      • afterGenericMetadataSync

        void afterGenericMetadataSync()
        After the synchronization of all generic meta data this is called, before any syncing of assets.

        This hook is only called in case the generic meta data has been synchronized without any exception.

        Although this task is executed in an asynchronous way, synchronization of assets only starts after this tasks ends successfully. Any aborts, crashes or unsuccessfully endings are aborting the overall synchronization process immediately - without syncing assets. Such ending usually is indicated by throwing an exception.

        Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization. So make sure all exceptions to be ignored are caught within the task.

      • createSyncBinaryAsset

        ISyncBinaryAsset createSyncBinaryAsset()
        Factory function to create a new instance representing target's data structure for a Binary Assets.

        The newly created instance MUST NOT be stored automatically on the sync target prior to returning it. For storing this instance, it will be passed to this sync target via importNewTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[]).

        Returns:
        must return a fresh instance for every call and must not ever return null.
        See Also:
        ISyncAsset

      • createSyncCompoundAsset

        ISyncCompoundAsset createSyncCompoundAsset()
        Factory function to create a new instance representing target's compound assets.

        The newly created instance MUST NOT be stored automatically on the sync target prior to returning it. For storing this instance, it will be passed to this sync target via importNewTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[]).

        Returns:
        must return a fresh instance for every call and must not ever return null.
        See Also:
        ISyncAsset

      • createSyncLicenseOption

        ISyncLicenseOption createSyncLicenseOption()
        Factory function to create a new instance representing target's lincense option data structure.

        The newly created instance SHOULD NOT be stored automatically on the sync target prior to returning it. For storing this instance, it will be attached to an asset via ISyncAsset.setLicenseOptions(ISyncLicenseOption[]) and thus passed to this sync target via one of importNewTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[]), importNewTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[]), updateTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[]), updateTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[])

        Returns:
        must return a fresh instance for every call and must not ever return null.

      • createSyncLicenseTerm

        ISyncLicenseTerm createSyncLicenseTerm()
        Factory function to create a new instance representing target's lincense terms data structure.

        The newly created instance SHOULD NOT be stored automatically on the sync target prior to returning it. For storing this instance, it will be attached to an asset via ISyncAsset.setLicenseTerms(ISyncLicenseTerm[]) and thus passed to this sync target via one of importNewTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[]), importNewTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[]), updateTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[]), updateTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[])

        Returns:
        must return a fresh instance for every call and must not ever return null.

      • createSyncReleaseDetails

        ISyncReleaseDetails createSyncReleaseDetails()
        Factory function to create a new instance representing target's release details structure.

        The newly created instance SHOULD NOT be stored automatically on the sync target prior to returning it. For storing this instance, it will be attached to an asset via ISyncAsset.setReleaseDetails(ISyncReleaseDetails) and thus passed to this sync target via one of importNewTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[]), importNewTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[]), updateTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[]), updateTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[])

        Returns:
        must return a fresh instance for every call and must not ever return null.

      • createSyncDownloadConstraints

        ISyncDownloadConstraints createSyncDownloadConstraints()
        Factory function to create a new instance representing target's downloads constraints data structure.

        The newly created instance SHOULD NOT be stored automatically on the sync target prior to returning it. For storing this instance, it will be attached to an asset via ISyncAsset.setDownloadConstraints(ISyncDownloadConstraints) and thus passed to this sync target via one of importNewTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[]), importNewTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[]), updateTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[]), updateTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[])

        Returns:
        must return a fresh instance for every call and must not ever return null.

      • beforeAssetsSync

        boolean beforeAssetsSync()
        Is called right before assets are about to be synced but after beforeSync() and after afterGenericMetadataSync().

        This hook is only called right before any assets are to be synced.

        Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization. So make sure all exceptions to be ignored are caught within the task.

        Returns:
        A boolean value, indicating whether to continue asset synchronization or not. true means, synchronization will continue, whereas false aborts the sync task without further notice and without calling afterAssetsSync() or afterSync().

      • getTargetCompoundAssetUuid

        String getTargetCompoundAssetUuid(String assetUuid)
        Maps the Smint.io ID of a Compound Asset to a synchronization target ID/key.
        Parameters:
        assetUuid - the ID of the compound asset on the Smint.io platform.
        Returns:
        the key on the synchronization target, or null in case the element does not exist yet on the target.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter is null.
        See Also:
        getContentProviderKey(String), ISyncAsset

      • getTargetAssetBinaryUuid

        String getTargetAssetBinaryUuid(String assetUuid,
                                String binaryUuid)
        Maps the Smint.io ID of a Binary Asset to a synchronization target ID/key.
        Parameters:
        assetUuid - the ID of the asset on the Smint.io platform.
        binaryUuid - the ID of the binary data on the Smint.io platform.
        Returns:
        the key on the synchronization target, or null in case the element does not exist yet on the target.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter is null.
        See Also:
        getContentProviderKey(String), ISyncAsset

      • importNewTargetAssets

        void importNewTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[] newTargetAssets)
        Stores new entries for assets on the synchronization target, these must be created on the target.

        Creating new entries is only called for new assets available on the Smin.io platform but not yet on the sync target. Implementing classes can be sure, these items do not exist yet and do not need to perform any checks for duplicates.

        Parameters:
        newTargetAssets - the list of new assets to create on the sync target. Ignore in case the list is empty ore null.

      • updateTargetAssets

        void updateTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[] updatedTargetAssets)
        Updates already existing entries for assets on the synchronization target.

        Updating entries is only called for already existing assets on both sides (Smint.io + sync target). However, no information is available which data of an asset has changed. Hence implementing classes should check binaries for changes, too - based on the version number of the binary (see ISmintIoBinary.getVersion()).

        Parameters:
        updatedTargetAssets - the list of updates, existing assets to create on the sync target. Ignore in case the list is empty ore null.

      • importNewTargetCompoundAssets

        void importNewTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[] newTargetCompoundAssets)
        Creates new entries for assets on the synchronization target.

        Creating new entries is only called for new assets available on the Smin.io platform but not yet on the sync target. Implementing classes can be sure, these items do not exist yet and do not need to perform any checks for duplicates.

        Parameters:
        newTargetCompoundAssets - the list of new compound assets to create on the sync target. Ignore in case the list is empty ore null.

      • updateTargetCompoundAssets

        void updateTargetCompoundAssets(ISyncCompoundAsset[] updatedTargetCompoundAssets)
        Updates already existing entries for compound assets on the synchronization target.

        Updating entries is only called for already existing assets on both sides (Smint.io + sync target). However, no information is available which data of an asset has changed. Hence implementing classes should check binaries for changes, too - based on the version number of the binary (see ISmintIoBinary.getVersion()).

        Parameters:
        updatedTargetCompoundAssets - the list of updates, existing assets to create on the sync target. Ignore in case the list is empty ore null.

      • afterAssetsSync

        void afterAssetsSync()
        After the synchronization of all assets this is called, but before afterAssetsSync().

        Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization without calling afterSync(). So make sure all exceptions to be ignored are caught within the task.

      • handleAuthenticatorException

        void handleAuthenticatorException(SmintIoAuthenticatorException exception)
        Is called in case an Smint.io API authentication exception has occurred.

        This function is the final call after an authentication exception occurred. No resumption is possible. The idea is, to perform some clean-up and notify the user or the system administrator, that an exception has occurred. After that, the synchronizing is terminated immediately - even without calling clearGenericMetadataCaches().

        Authentication to the Smint.io API is performed right before the start of the synchronization process. In case an error occurs, authorization is tried a second time. So most of the time authentication exceptions happen here. Nevertheless in theory it is possible that the authentication becomes invalid due to session timeout after a long pause. Then a refresh of the authentication token is tried. In the event that re-authentication fails, this function is called in the course of a running synchronization process. So you never know, when shit happens. Nevertheless, since synchronization is no task with big pauses or rest periods, the authenticated session should not expire easily and thus most of the time this exception will occur right at the start of the sync process.

        Parameters:
        exception - the exception that has been caught in the synchronization process. The handler might take advantage of more information about the exception to handle.

      • handleSyncJobException

        void handleSyncJobException(SmintIoSyncJobException exception)
        Is called in case any exception in the course of synchronizing occurs, besides an authentication exception.

        This function is the final call after any exception occurred. No resumption is possible. The idea is, to perform some clean-up and notify the user or the system administrator, that an exception has occurred. After that, the synchronizing is terminated immediately - even without calling clearGenericMetadataCaches().

        Whenever any of the synchronization functions (like importNewTargetAssets(ISyncBinaryAsset[])) throws an exception, synchronization is terminated immediately. Eventually this function is called but not other clean-up utility function, like clearGenericMetadataCaches() or any after... function. So in case of any exception, this handler is the final chance to perform clean-up and prepare everything for the next run to work better.

        Parameters:
        exception - the exception that has been caught in the synchronization process. The handler might take advantage of more information about the exception to handle.

      • afterSync

        void afterSync()
        A hook to be called after all synchronization took place.

        After all synchronization took place, some clean-up might be necessary, besides clearGenericMetadataCaches(). This is executed after all synchronization has ended but before clearGenericMetadataCaches() is called. So the running task still has access to all the created caches.

        Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization. Since this is the last task to perform at the end of the synchronization, this might be negligible.

      • clearGenericMetadataCaches

        void clearGenericMetadataCaches()
        Clears all cached generic meta data.

        During synchronization of license information, asset types, release states and content categories, a lot of meta data is usually cached locally to avoid multiple remote lookups. This speeds-up the synchronization of these meta data items. But before synchronization of content takes place and at the end of each synchronization process, this cache is cleared. In the former case it will guarantee a fresh start and will avoid any errors due to failure in meta data sync process. The latter releases all memory consumed by the cache.
